label: ABC2_mP16_14_e_e_2e-005
title: $\beta$-LiErO$_{2}$ Structure
comments:
This is the low-temperature structure of LiErO$_{2}$, with data taken at 150K. The room temperature structure, $\alpha$-LiErO$_{2}$, takes on the \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_tI16_141_a_b_e-003}{$\gamma$-LiFeO$_{2}$} structure. 
 The $\alpha$-, $\beta$-, {\em etc.} notation for LiRO$_{2}$ (R = rare earth) can be found in (Faucher, 1988). For more information see the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C_mP16_14_e_2e_e-002}{$\delta$-LiSmO$_{2}$} page. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_mP16_14_e_e_2e-003}{KNO$_{2}$ (III)}, \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_mP16_14_e_e_2e-004}{manganite (MnOOH)}, and \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_mP16_14_e_e_2e-005}{$\beta$-LiErO$_{2}$} have the same AFLOW label, ABC2\_mP16\_14\_e\_e\_2e. The structures are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
